translated: the serial absorptions are in the world,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation are in the world,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the clairvoyances are in the world,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the meditative stabilizations are in the world,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways are in the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas exist in the world,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams 'jig rten na yod ba yin /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams 'jig rten na yod ba yin /
translated: the fearlessnesses exist in the world,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /🔽byams pa chen po 'jig rten na yod ba yin /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin / byams pa chen po 'jig rten na yod ba yin /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges exist in the world,🔽great love exists in the world,

original: snying rje chen po 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: snying rje chen po 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: great compassion exists in the world,

original: @402a *// sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: @402a *// sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha exist in the world,

original: chos kyi dbyings 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the dharma-constituent exists in the world,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the very limit of reality exists in the world,

original: de bzhin nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /🔽ma nor ba de bzhin nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: suchness exists in the world,🔽non-erroneous suchness exists in the world,

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /🔽chos nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /🔽chos kyi gnas nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin / chos nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin / chos kyi gnas nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: unchanging suchness exists in the world,🔽the true nature exists in the world,🔽the dharma-element exists in the world,

original: chos skyon med pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: chos skyon med pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the establishment of the dharma exists in the world,🔽the certification of the dharma exists in the world,

original: mig lnga 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: mig lnga 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the five eyes exist in the world,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the fruit of entering the stream exists in the world,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more birth exists in the world,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth exists in the world,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: arhatship exists in the world,

original: rang byang chub 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: rang byang chub 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: individual enlightenment exists in the world,

original: thams cad shes pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: the knowledge of all aspects exists in the world,

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid 'jig rten ma yod pa yin /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid 'jig rten ma yod pa yin /
translated: the path that is the knowledge of path aspects exists in the world,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin ////
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin ////
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects exists in the world.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po brgya nyer bzhi pa //
analyzed: bam po brgya nyer bzhi pa //
translated: PART 124

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: byang chub sems dpa' yod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yod na /
translated: If there are bodhisattvas,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the ten wholesome actions exist in the world to be labeled,

original: bsam gtan bzhi 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the four concentrations exist in the world to be labeled,

original: tshad med pa bzhi 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa @402b yin /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa @402b yin /
translated: the four immeasurables are found in the world;

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the four formless absorptions are found in the world;

original: mngon par shes pa lnga 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the five kinds of supernormal knowledge are found in the world;

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the perfection of generosity is found in the world;

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the perfection of moral discipline is found in the world;🔽the perfection of patience is found in the world;

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the perfection of perseverance is found in the world;

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the perfection of concentration is found in the world;

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is found in the world;

original: nang stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: inner emptiness is found in the world;

original: phyi stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / phyi nang stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: External emptiness exists as a designation in the world.🔽Internal and external emptiness exists as a designation in the world.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: Emptiness of emptiness exists as a designation in the world.

original: chen po stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽don dam pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / don dam pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: Great emptiness exists as a designation in the world.🔽Ultimate emptiness exists as a designation in the world.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽'dus ma byas stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: Emptiness of the conditioned exists as a designation in the world.🔽Emptiness of the unconditioned exists as a designation in the world.

original: mtha' las 'das ba stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽dor ba med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das ba stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: Emptiness of what is beyond extremes exists as a designation in the world.🔽Emptiness of what is beginningless and endless exists as a designation in the world.🔽Emptiness of nonrejection exists as a designation in the world.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid 'jig @403a *//🔽rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid 'jig @403a *//🔽rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: Emptiness of inherent existence exists as a designation in the world.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena exists as a designation in the world.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: The emptiness of defining characteristics exists as a designation in the world.🔽The emptiness of nonobservation exists as a designation in the world.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: The emptiness of nonthings exists as a designation in the world.🔽The emptiness of essence exists as a designation in the world.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: The emptiness of the essence of nonthings exists as a designation in the world.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽yang dag par spong ba rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / yang dag par spong ba rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: The applications of mindfulness exist as designations in the world.🔽The right efforts exist as designations in the world.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽dbang po rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / dbang po rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: The legs of manifestation exist as designations in the world.🔽The faculties exist as designations in the world.

original: stobs rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: stobs rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: The powers exist as designations in the world.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the factors of awakening are imputed in the world,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the noble eightfold path is imputed in the world,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the noble truths are imputed in the world,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the liberations are imputed in the world,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the serial absorptions are imputed in the world,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation are imputed in the world,

original: mngon @403b par shes pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: mngon @403b par shes pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the higher knowledges are imputed in the world,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the meditative stabilizations are imputed in the world,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways are imputed in the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas are imputed in the world,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the fearlessnesses are knowable in the world,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges are knowable in the world,

original: snying rje chen po 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: snying rje chen po 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: great compassion is knowable in the world,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the distinct attributes of a buddha are knowable in the world,

original: thams cad shes pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: all-knowledge is knowable in the world,

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the knowledge of path aspects is knowable in the world,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: the knowledge of all aspects is knowable in the world,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: stream enterers are knowable in the world,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin / phyir mi 'ong ba 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: once-returners are knowable in the world,🔽non-returners are knowable in the world,

original: dgra bcom pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: arhats are knowable in the world,

original: rang sangs rgyas 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin /
translated: pratyekabuddhas are knowable in the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha is designated in the world.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yod na /
analyzed: dper na / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yod na /
translated: when the orb of the moon exists,

original: rtsis dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma thams cad gdags su yod do //
analyzed: rtsis dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma thams cad gdags su yod do //
translated: all calculations, constellations, and stars are designated.

original: koo shi ka /🔽de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i @404a *//
analyzed: koo shi ka / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i @404a *//
translated: Kauśika,🔽in the same way, when the orb of the moon of the bodhisattva

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yod na /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yod na /
translated: exists,

original: dge ba'i spyod pa dang / yang dag pa'i spyod pa dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i spyod pa dang / yang dag pa'i spyod pa dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the practice of virtue, the practice of reality, the path of the ten virtuous actions, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the superknowledges, the perfections,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the factors of awakening, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the noble truths, the liberations, the serial absorptions, the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rtsi thams cad gdags su yod do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rtsi thams cad gdags su yod do //
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and all the special qualities of a buddha can be designated.

original: slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyu skar dang / skar ma thams cad kyang gdags su yod do //
analyzed: slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyu skar dang / skar ma thams cad kyang gdags su yod do //
translated: The stars and constellations of the learners, the non-learners, the hearers, and the solitary realizers can all be designated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang 'jig rten na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang 'jig rten na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One will also exist in the world.”

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'jig rten du ma byung ba de'i tshe na'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can rnams la 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chos ston to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'jig rten du ma byung ba de'i tshe na'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can rnams la 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chos ston to //
translated: Even when the Blessed Buddhas do not appear in the world, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas teach the Dharma to sentient beings, both mundane and supramundane.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the vehicles,🔽namely the Hearer Vehicle, the Solitary Realizer Vehicle, and the Great Vehicle,

original: byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni /🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po rnams te /
translated: arise from the Bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' @404b sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa gang dang ldan pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @404b sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa gang dang ldan pas /
translated: The Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, endowed with skill in means,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: practice the perfection of giving, practice the perfection of morality, practice the perfection of patience, practice the perfection of effort,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /🔽stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: to the perfection of meditative stability, to the perfection of wisdom, to inner emptiness, to outer emptiness, to outer and inner emptiness,🔽to the emptiness of emptiness, to great emptiness, to the emptiness of ultimate reality, to the emptiness of the conditioned, to the emptiness of the unconditioned,

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: to the emptiness of the unlimited, to the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, to the emptiness of non-dispersal, to the emptiness of inherent existence,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: It is to practice the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of nonexistence, the emptiness of essential nature,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: the emptiness of the essential nature of nonexistence, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / @405a *//
analyzed: dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / @405a *//
translated: the faculties, the powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang /🔽gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: to practice the branches of awakening, to practice the noble eightfold path, to practice the noble truths, to practice the concentrations, to practice the immeasurables,

original: smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: to practice the formless absorptions, to practice the eight deliverances, to practice the nine serial absorptions, to practice the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are the gateways to liberation, to practice the clairvoyances, to practice the meditative stabilities, to practice the dhāraṇī gateways, to practice the powers of the tathāgatas, to practice the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod pa dang / byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod pa dang / nyan thos kyi sar mi ltung ba dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod pa dang / byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod pa dang / nyan thos kyi sar mi ltung ba dang /
translated: It is to engage in the correct and discerning awarenesses, to engage in great love, to engage in great compassion, to engage in the distinct qualities of the Buddha, to not fall into the level of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis mngon du mi byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / tshe phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sems can phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis mngon du mi byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / tshe phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sems can phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: to not actualize the level of the pratyekabuddhas, to ripen beings, to purify a buddha realm, to take up the perfection of lifespan, to take up the perfection of beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' phun sum @405b tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' phun sum @405b tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: and the skillful means for attaining the knowledge of all modes, should be known as issuing from this perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka / gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kausika,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de ni /
translated: further, that son or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, preach and study it, and wisely attend to it,

original: tshe 'di'i yon tan 'di dag dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan 'di dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i yon tan 'di dag dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan 'di dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be endowed with these good qualities in this very life, and with these good qualities in other lives as well.🔽Sakra:

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord!

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de tshe 'di'i yon tan gang dang ldan par 'gyur pa lags /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de tshe 'di'i yon tan gang dang ldan par 'gyur pa lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what qualities will a son of good family or a daughter of good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and properly pays attention to this perfection of wisdom have in this very life?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: a son of good family or a daughter of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de /🔽sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa ma gtogs par dug gis dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽mtshon gyis dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de / sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa ma gtogs par dug gis dus byed par mi 'gyur ro // mtshon gyis dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and properly pays attention to this perfection of wisdom🔽will not die from poison,🔽will not die from a weapon,

original: mes dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mes dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not die from fire,

original: chus dus byed par mi 'gyur ba nas nad brgya rtsa gcig gi bar gyis dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chus dus byed par mi 'gyur ba nas nad brgya rtsa gcig gi bar gyis dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not die from water, and so on, up to they will not die from the one hundred and one diseases.

original: rgyal po dang blon pos gnod par bya ba zhig byung ba las /
analyzed: rgyal po dang blon pos gnod par bya ba zhig byung ba las /
translated: If a king or a minister should do something harmful,

original: gal te rigs kyi bu'am @406a *//
analyzed: gal te rigs kyi bu'am @406a *//
translated: if a son of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di kha ton du byed cing rgyal po'i pho brang du song na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di kha ton du byed cing rgyal po'i pho brang du song na /
translated: or a daughter of a good family should go to the king’s palace, reciting this perfection of wisdom,

original: de la glags 'tshol ba de dag gis glags mi rnyed de /
analyzed: de la glags 'tshol ba de dag gis glags mi rnyed de /
translated: those who are looking for an opportunity to harm will not find an opportunity.

original: rgyal po'i bu dang / rgyal po'i blon po chen po dag kyang gtam dri ba dang / gtam bya bar sems shing dga' bar bya bar sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu dang / rgyal po'i blon po chen po dag kyang gtam dri ba dang / gtam bya bar sems shing dga' bar bya bar sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: The king’s sons and the king’s ministers will think, ‘We should ask questions and we should think about what is delightful.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid kyi gzi brjid dang / mthus de ltar sems so //
analyzed: de ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid kyi gzi brjid dang / mthus de ltar sems so //
translated: it is because of the brilliance and power of this perfection of wisdom itself that they think like that.

original: gal te rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: gal te rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: If a son of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di kha ton byed cing rgyal po'i pho brang du song na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di kha ton byed cing rgyal po'i pho brang du song na /
translated: “If, Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family, having taken up this perfection of wisdom, were to go to the king’s palace,

original: de la rgyal po'i bu'am /
analyzed: de la rgyal po'i bu'am /
translated: then the king’s sons

original: rgyal po'i blon po chen po dag kyang dga' ba'i tshig gis gtam dri ba dang / gtam bya bar sems shing /
analyzed: rgyal po'i blon po chen po dag kyang dga' ba'i tshig gis gtam dri ba dang / gtam bya bar sems shing /
translated: or the king’s ministers would think of asking questions and having discussions with her with words of delight,

original: dga' bar bya bar sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bar bya bar sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: and would think of delighting in her.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /🔽de ni / 'di ltar rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de ni / 'di ltar rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika,

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems nye bar bzhag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems nye bar bzhag /
translated: it is because those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family have set up a mind of love for all beings,

original: snying rje'i sems dang / dga' ba'i sems dang / btang snyoms kyi sems nye bar bzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snying rje'i sems dang / dga' ba'i sems dang / btang snyoms kyi sems nye bar bzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: have set up a mind of compassion, a mind of joy, and a mind of equanimity.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and properly pays attention to this perfection of wisdom

original: tshe 'di'i yon tan de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i yon tan de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: will have those good qualities in this life.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: tshe rabs gzhan @406b gyi yon tan gang dag dang ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan @406b gyi yon tan gang dag dang ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what good qualities will they have in other lives?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: they will never be separated from the ten wholesome actions,

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang /
translated: the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the six perfections, the four establishments in mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four foundations for supernormal ability,

original: dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /🔽rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
translated: the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the path, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,🔽the liberations, the serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the aspects of correct understanding, and the distinct attributes of the Buddha.

original: de sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam gyi dbang ma gtogs par nam yang sems can dmyal bar mi skye /
analyzed: de sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam gyi dbang ma gtogs par nam yang sems can dmyal bar mi skye /
translated: Except for the power of his aspiration to ripen sentient beings, he will never be born in the hells.

original: byol song gi skye gnas su mi skye /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su mi skye /
translated: He will never be born in the animal realm.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du mi skye'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du mi skye'o //
translated: He will never be born in the world of Yama.

original: de nam yang yan lag nyams pa can du mi 'gyur /🔽nam yang dbul po'i rigs @407a *//
analyzed: de nam yang yan lag nyams pa can du mi 'gyur / nam yang dbul po'i rigs @407a *//
translated: He will never be born with incomplete faculties.

original: su mi skye /🔽smyig ma mkhan gyi rigs sam /🔽sme sha can gyi rigs sam /
analyzed: su mi skye / smyig ma mkhan gyi rigs sam / sme sha can gyi rigs sam /
translated: He will never be born into a poor family.🔽He will never be born into a family of weavers,🔽or into a family of outcastes,

original: mgar ba'am / phyag dar ba'am /🔽shen pa'am / phag gsod pa'i rigs sam /
analyzed: mgar ba'am / phyag dar ba'am / shen pa'am / phag gsod pa'i rigs sam /
translated: or into a family of blacksmiths, or into a family of scavengers,🔽or into a family of butchers,

original: dmangs rigs su mi skye ste /
analyzed: dmangs rigs su mi skye ste /
translated: or into a family of pig farmers.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: He will always be endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu brdzus shing skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu brdzus shing skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: He will be born miraculously in those world systems where the blessed buddhas are present, where they live, are well, and have a sense of well-being.

original: nam yang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: nam yang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: He will never be without the superknowledges of the bodhisattvas.

original: de 'dod na /
analyzed: de 'dod na /
translated: If he wishes,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / chos nyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / chos nyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: he will go from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to see, venerate, and serve the lord buddhas and to hear the Dharma.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing /🔽sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: He will go from buddhafield to buddhafield

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: while bringing beings to maturity and purifying a buddhafield.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: therefore

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: a son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo yon tan 'di dag phun sum tshogs par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung bar bya /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo yon tan 'di dag phun sum tshogs par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung bar bya /
translated: a daughter of a good family who wants to perfect these good qualities should take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: bcang bar bya /
analyzed: bcang bar bya /
translated: carry it,

original: bklag par bya /🔽kun chub par bya /
analyzed: bklag par bya / kun chub par bya /
translated: read it,🔽master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bya /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bya /
translated: and properly pay attention to it.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang ma bral bar bya ste /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang ma bral bar bya ste / de dag ni /
translated: and not be separated from the thought of complete knowing.

original: nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs @407b par sangs rgyas kyi bar du tshe 'di'i yon tan dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs @407b par sangs rgyas kyi bar du tshe 'di'i yon tan dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: And they will have those good qualities in this life and in other lives until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: le'u bcu dgu pa'o ////🔽de nas mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba glags pa lta ba'i bsam pa can brgya tsam zhig bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su dong ba dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: le'u bcu dgu pa'o //// de nas mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba glags pa lta ba'i bsam pa can brgya tsam zhig bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su dong ba dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: This was the nineteenth chapter on “The Perfection of Wisdom” in the “Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.”🔽Then about a hundred non-Buddhist ascetics and wandering mendicants with the view of nihilism went to where the Lord was. Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, thought,

original: mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba brgya po glags pa lta ba'i bsam pa can 'di dag bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong na /
analyzed: mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba brgya po glags pa lta ba'i bsam pa can 'di dag bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong na /
translated: “These hundred non-Buddhist ascetics and wandering mendicants with the view of nihilism have gone to where the Lord is.

original: de la bdag gis ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod pas mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du dong nas bar chad byed par mi 'gyur bar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di snyed cig gzung ba de dag kha ton du bya'o /
analyzed: de la bdag gis ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod pas mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du dong nas bar chad byed par mi 'gyur bar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di snyed cig gzung ba de dag kha ton du bya'o /
translated: I will recite aloud the perfection of wisdom as much as I have learned from the Lord, so that these other tīrthikas and wandering mendicants will not go to the Lord and create obstacles.”

original: snyam nas de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji snyed cig bzung ba de dag kha ton du brjod do //
analyzed: snyam nas de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji snyed cig bzung ba de dag kha ton du brjod do //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, recited aloud the perfection of wisdom as much as he had learned from the Lord.

original: de nas mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba de dag rgyang ring po ring po nas bcom ldan 'das la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas phyir dong ngo //
analyzed: de nas mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba de dag rgyang ring po ring po nas bcom ldan 'das la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas phyir dong ngo //
translated: Then those other tīrthikas and wandering mendicants circumambulated the Lord keeping the right side toward him from afar and left by the same path and the same gate by which they had come.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra thought this:

original: de ltar mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba de dag gis rgyang ring po ring po nas bcom @408a *//
analyzed: de ltar mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba de dag gis rgyang ring po ring po nas bcom @408a *//
translated: In this way, those tīrthikas and parivrājakas saw the Blessed One from a great distance.

original: ldan 'das la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: ldan 'das la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te /
translated: In this way, those tīrthikas and parivrājakas circumambulated the Blessed One, keeping him to the right, from afar.

original: lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas phyir dong na /
analyzed: lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas phyir dong na /
translated: Then they left by the same path and the same gate.

original: de ci'i rgyu zhig snyam pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu'i sems kyi kun tu rtog pa thugs su chud nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ci'i rgyu zhig snyam pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu'i sems kyi kun tu rtog pa thugs su chud nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
translated: “What is the reason for that?” Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts that were in the mind of the venerable Śāradvatīputra, said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ni / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsams pas /
analyzed: de ni / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsams pas /
translated: it is because Śakra, Lord of the Gods, has contemplated the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba 'di dag rgyang ring po ring po nas nga la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas phyir dong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba 'di dag rgyang ring po ring po nas nga la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas phyir dong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, those other tīrthikas and parivrājakas circumambulated me from afar, keeping me to the right, and left by the same path and the same gate.”🔽“Blessed One, what is the reason that those tīrthikas and parivrājakas circumambulated the Blessed One from afar, keeping him to the right, and left by the same path and the same gate?”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba 'di dag las 'ga' tsam la'ang dkar po'i sems dang ldan pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba 'di dag las 'ga' tsam la'ang dkar po'i sems dang ldan pa ma mthong ste /
translated: I do not see even one among these non-Buddhist ascetics and wandering mendicants who has a virtuous mind.

original: mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba 'di dag thams cad ni /🔽gnod par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mu stegs can gzhan dang / kun tu rgyu ba 'di dag thams cad ni / gnod par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: All these non-Buddhist ascetics and wandering mendicants🔽have malicious minds.

original: glags lta ba'i bsam pa can sha stag ste /
analyzed: glags lta ba'i bsam pa can sha stag ste /
translated: They are all intent on finding fault.

original: 'khor 'dir 'ong bar sems pa sha stag kyang sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'khor 'dir 'ong bar sems pa sha stag kyang sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, I think that they will come to this assembly.

original: ngas ni / 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa /
analyzed: ngas ni / 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, I do not see anyone in the world with its gods,

original: bdud dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas pa /
translated: with its Māra and Brahmā,

original: tshangs par bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgu'i nang na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe zhe sdang ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: tshangs par bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgu'i nang na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe zhe sdang ba'i sems sam /
translated: with its śramaṇas and brahmins, who, when this perfection of wisdom is being taught, would approach with a malicious mind

original: glags lta ba'i bsam pas nye bar 'gro ba ma mthong ste /
analyzed: glags lta ba'i bsam pas nye bar 'gro ba ma mthong ste /
translated: or with the intention of finding fault.

original: de ni / gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni / gnas med do //
translated: That is impossible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de ni / @408b 'di ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu dang /🔽tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang /
analyzed: de ni / @408b 'di ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang /
translated: It is like this: in this world system of a billion worlds, there are the sons of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, the Trāyastriṃśa, Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇa­rata, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realms,🔽the Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Brahmapārṣadya, Mahābrahma, Ābhāsvara, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Śubha­kṛtsna, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha,

original: dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lha gang ji snyed cig yod pa dang /
analyzed: dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lha gang ji snyed cig yod pa dang /
translated: Śubhakṛtsna, Bṛhatphala, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, Śubhakṛtsna, Bṛhatphala, Avṛha, Atapa, Sudarśana, and Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: All the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas that there are, and all the bodhisattvas that there are, have taken up this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / de dag thams cad ni /
translated: And why is that?🔽It is because

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: all of them have come forth from the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
translated: Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, in the eastern direction, in world systems numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, there are as many buddhas, bhagavats, together with their saṅgha of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / @409a *//
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / @409a *//
translated: gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

original: lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: All those great serpents have also taken up this perfection of wisdom.🔽And why?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / de dag thams cad ni /
translated: Because

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
translated: all of them have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.

original: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
translated: In the southern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, there are as many Buddhas, Blessed Ones, with their communities of monks and nuns, as many solitary buddhas, bodhisattva great beings,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: All the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas also uphold this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni /
translated: And why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
translated: It is because all of them have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.

original: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
translated: In the west, in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, there are as many lord buddhas with their śrāvaka saṅghas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattva great beings,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: All the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas also uphold this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i @409b phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i @409b phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / de dag thams cad ni /
translated: It is because all of them

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
translated: have come forth from the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
translated: In the northern direction, in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, there are as many lord buddhas with their śrāvaka saṅghas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattva great beings,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: All the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas also uphold this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / de dag thams cad ni /
translated: And why is that?🔽It is because

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
translated: they all come forth from the perfection of wisdom.

original: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
analyzed: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
translated: In the same way, in the northern direction, in the southern direction, in the southeastern direction, in the southwestern direction, in the northwestern direction, in the northeastern direction, in the downward direction, and in the upward direction there are as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, and in each world system there are as many teachings of the tathāgatas as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / de dag thams cad ni /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go /
translated: they all come forth from the perfection of wisdom.

original: @411a *// steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
analyzed: @411a *// steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
translated: “In the world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, the lord buddhas, together with their saṅgha of hearers and the solitary buddhas, and the bodhisattva great beings, and the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas all uphold this perfection of wisdom.
